intro: Spuriopimpinella nikoensis, commonly known as Niko's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences, and it has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
